'Yemen Capital Sanaa' - 116 News Result(s)

World News | Agence France-Presse | Friday May 31, 2024

Joint US-British air strikes hit several sites in Yemen including the capital Sanaa and a key port city overnight Thursday to Friday, witnesses and UK authorities said.

www.ndtv.com

India News | Press Trust of India | Monday April 25, 2022

Seven Indian sailors were among 14 foreigners released on Sunday from the Houthi-controlled Yemeni capital of Sanaa, Oman's Foreign Minister Badr Albusaidi said.

www.ndtv.com

World News | Agence France-Presse | Tuesday January 18, 2022

Eleven people were killed in coalition air strikes on Yemen's rebel-held capital Sanaa, a witness and medical sources told AFP Tuesday, after the insurgents launched a rare and deadly attack on the United Arab Emirates.

www.ndtv.com

World News | Reuters | Wednesday August 21, 2019

A U.S. military MQ-9 drone was shot down in Yemen's Dhamar governate, southeast of the Houthi-controlled capital Sanaa, two U.S. officials told Reuters on Wednesday.

www.ndtv.com

World News | Agence France-Presse | Thursday May 16, 2019

Saudi-led coalition warplanes struck Yemeni rebel targets, including in the capital Sanaa, today, two days after the insurgents claimed drone strikes that shut a key oil pipeline in the neighbouring kingdom.

www.ndtv.com

World News | Agence France-Presse | Tuesday September 18, 2018

Twenty-four Yemenis, including a teenage girl, could face the death penalty in the rebel-held capital Sanaa on charges linked to their minority Bahai faith, Amnesty International said Tuesday.

www.ndtv.com

World News | Reuters | Saturday August 26, 2017

Her bruised eyes still swollen shut, Buthaina Muhammad Mansour, believed to be four or five, doesn't yet know that her parents, five siblings and uncle were killed when an air strike flattened their home in Yemen's capital.

www.ndtv.com

World News | Reuters | Friday April 14, 2017

A court in Yemen's Houthi-controlled capital Sanaa has sentenced a veteran reporter to death for spying for the group's main enemy Saudi Arabia, Houthi media and a journalists' association have reported.

www.ndtv.com

World News | Reuters | Thursday February 16, 2017

Warplanes of the Saudi-led coalition struck a house north of Yemen's capital where a crowd of mourners had gathered, residents said on Thursday, killing nine women and a child and injuring dozens.

www.ndtv.com

World News | Agence France-Presse | Sunday October 16, 2016

The Saudi-led coalition battling Yemeni rebels said Saturday that one of its warplanes had "wrongly targeted" a funeral in the capital Sanaa, killing more than 140 people, and announced disciplinary proceedings.

www.ndtv.com

World News | Reuters | Tuesday October 11, 2016

More cases of cholera have been registered in the Yemeni capital Sanaa, a World Health Organization (WHO) official said on Tuesday.

www.ndtv.com

World News | Reuters | Saturday September 24, 2016

Four members of al Qaeda's Yemen branch, including a local commander, were killed in a suspected US drone strike on a vehicle traveling east of the capital Sanaa, two local officials said on Saturday.

www.ndtv.com

World News | Reuters | Tuesday August 9, 2016

A Saudi-led military coalition conducted air strikes on the Yemeni capital Sanaa on Tuesday for the first time in five months, residents said, after UN-backed peace talks to end the conflict broke down over the weekend.

www.ndtv.com

World News | Reuters | Sunday August 7, 2016

Forces loyal to President Abd-Rabbu Mansour Hadi launched a new offensive east of the Yemeni capital Sanaa on Saturday, the military command said, after United Nations-sponsored peace talks in Kuwait ended without an agreement.

www.ndtv.com

World News | Agence France-Presse | Monday March 28, 2016

Shiite rebels who control the Yemeni capital Sanaa have released nine Saudis in exchange for 109 Yemenis, the Saudi-led coalition fighting them said Monday, ahead of planned peace talks next month.

www.ndtv.com
